intro: Pasania clementis, commonly known as the Clement's pasania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
